reviews.review_msg: CAN NOT UNDERSTAND WHAT IS HE TALKING ABOUT! HE ALWAYS GET CONFUSED BY HIMSELF. STRONGLY RECOMMEND THAT DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!

Honestly, avoid. Vasyl did not respond to emails. Teaching quality is okay but has no notes and is disorganized. Obviously did not want to teach/care about student concerns. Would have given 1.5/5 if it was an option.

Dont take any class with this professor. Never replys to emails, late or forgets to post assignments and quiz, office hours are very inconvenient, no powerpoint and notes, doesnt take students seriously, and makes difficult tests to lower grade.

Although exams are not difficult compared with other courses, the professor is disorganized and does not communicate with students very well. For example, he did not upload assignments and quizzes until the due date, and he makes many mistakes during lectures. I even found mistakes on the answer key of assignments but no announcement. horribleprof

Maybe he has the knowledge but he is definitely not qualified for teaching. The worst prof ever in the history. He will not respond to emails of all kinds. He seems nice and easy going but don't let that fool you. He only cares about his soccer games.
By far the worst professor I have ever encountered. Avoid at all costs. I would give him a zero if I could. How this man has a job at a university is beyond me.

This prof is the worst as he doesnt give out any clear information, neither does he explain important concepts. He expects you already know everything, get ready to study on your own. Best to avoid this prof.

Basil is a great prof, but ECON 325 is really heavy on numerical problems, if you don't have a strong foundation in math/calculus, probably best to avoid this course. Due to pandemic the course is 50% on assignment and 25/25 for final and midterm. Assignments are hard, and his chinese TA doesn't really help out if you email them.
Dont take his course

Suggest buy text instead of just relying on his brief notes for studying for exams. But expensive text. Overall decent lecturing. In lectures can catch him on mistakes. But helpful on office hrs. Some math questions but not too hard. Midterm was easy/fair, 6/10 question from notes, 4/10 was harder ones. Fair final, fair marking. Give him a B.

Very easy assignments. Very challenging exams. Notes are not clear enough... all over the place. Hard to link the notes into one clear topic. Nice guy to talk to. Mathematically challenging - rather sophisticated. Advice: do a lot of practices before exam.
bad prof ever had!!!! seriously!!! note and assignment is not the same as midterm and final!!! Also he doesn't seems to know what he is talking about!!!
Good notes and sometimes funny.  Good prof

the worst prof i've had in SFU, very unclear teaching plus useless notes. 80% of the time was "guessing" what he tried to say in lectures. the course material isn't that hard actually but you could never understand what he taught in class.
His teaching is very clear, useful notes. However, the midterm and final exam are very challenging.
Friendly prof. Knows what she is talking about. Easy exams. Nuff said.

Shora is a nice prof and obviously knows the material. Willing to hold extra office hours if you send emails to her. Although her hand-writing notes are bit messy, midterms are quite easy anyways. (Do the tutorial questions and you'll be fine).
She had extra office hours before the midterm. Very patient when I ask her questions. Even when I asked her questions like the exam ones, she answered patiently. Lots of real world examples.

Shora is very friendly to talk with and she was always ready to help when I sent her emails or went to her office hours. The course was not the easiest course I have taken, but not the hardest one either. If you go to the lectures and solve the tutorial questions, you can pass the course easily and learn a lot. I highly recommend her class.

Marie is one of the most organized and clear instructors I've had. She explains concepts in a way that's easy to understand —no surprises on the exams. Her exams are fair and based on lecture material, which really helps with preparation. She's also quick to respond to emails and genuinely cares about helping students. Highly recommend！

Terrible teacher. In my 4 years at SFU I am never encountered a prof like her. She is terrible. Not sure why she is allowed to teach and she is earning some stupid money by copying the textbook word for word. If you take her, you will need to go to a therapist. Do not take her class for the betterment of your mental health.

Honestly, awful prof. Her lectures are 40+ slides that are copied and pasted straight from the textbook. Not much explanation for the lectures she is providing. Textbook is no help either. She expects students to know every equation provided, not sure why. Terrible course content, terrible lectures all combined with a poor prof. AVOID Marie Rekkas!

I specifically made an account to leave a review after 5 years of using this site and never writing a single review. This proff is lazy af. Practice Qs assigned do not have any explanation to how she found the solution, the textbook doesn't have solutions. Useless TA spends 30 mins per question waiting for her to write the solution out.
good prof. hot prof. angry prof. smart prof.

Not gonna lie, I sleep in her class and still get A's. Her slides have spelling errors, and it's mostly self taught. Fortunately, her exams are Multiple choice, and economics is pretty easy if you study hard. If you do well in her class, it's because you taught yourself.
what is she even saying????
amazing lectures. she is the cream of the crop for this department and this university. you should get into her course. she's special and super smart. a real professor.

Honestly, throughout my whole uni life I have never seen a lazy and uncaring prof like her. Doesn't reply to emails or bother trying to communicate with us at all. The exams didn't have anything to do with the course materials she gave us(study the book). The practice questions she gave had answers for wrong questions. Avoid her at all cost!!!!!!

She reads off the slides which are from the book. In the online class, she never wrote down anything or solved any formula on screen. Just reading through. I found that youtube videos were better at explaining all concepts. Never take from her again.
She is a ridiculous professor, doesn't explain and expects you'll know it all. Don't take this course with her, I don't know how sfu is letting her teach.

"Good" prof, you'll get depressed taking her course. Things appeared on the exams never shown up in her lecture slides. Her slides are all directly from the textbook. Be ready to fail if you are happy to take her course. Get ready to get depression and see doctors. glhf.

if you are taking econ courses with this Professor or you are planning to take her courses, the only thing that i can say is "RUN". not only that you are 100% study on you own, but also the power point are very simple and most of them are from textbook. The test is very hard, and the time that she provided is not enough. NEVER TAKING AGAIN!!

She just made a presentation copy and pasting from the book, and reads the formulas. She mentions, she doesn't want to "overwhelm" us with math and never explains the formulas in detailed and everything on the exam requires formulas. No tutorial, no office hours, hard to reach the prof. Please find another prof.

Be ready to study on your own. As during online delivery of lectures, she is just recording lectures with poor audio and isn't there to help you. She doesn't even hold the tutorial sessions and when asked to do so, makes poor excuses. Lastly in my perspective she might be a good researcher but doesn't know how to teach and expects you know it all.

great prof with a serious attitude. don't come to class unprepared and falling asleep or you'll fail this course. marie is a real scholar and if you give a damn she'll help you do well. if you don't care, you'll fail.

Marie is helpful and really cares about her students. Always got back to you via email asap despite her busy schedule and explained the necessary concepts to get you a good grade. Does her part to ensure you do well on tests and exams. Would definitely take more classes with her in the future.

I really like Marie and her style of teaching, it's clear and concise. Overall she's great; however, be aware that her final exam is brutal. The final was long.. all that matters is how fast you can solve the problems in 2 hrs 30 minutes!! The midterm was okay. Aside from the final, this course was great.

She is a lazy prof. Always ends the class an hour early, and she didnt even show up for the final exam. Also her  office hour is only 1 hour per week when there are 120+people in class. If your ta happens to be Mike, avoid him and attend other tutorial cause he is clueless lol
She never reply any student's email. She is not helpful! Her midterm and final exams became very hard since this semester! Be aware of her!

Marie is a great prof takes time to help students.  She dedicated 2 lectures for review before exams.  She answers emails and will schedule office hours by appointment.  She  wants to stimulate class discussion to help overall understanding of concepts and  it sucks that the response from the class is deathly silence and blank stares.

Handwritings are hard to recognize. The explainings of examples are totally unclear. Mid-term is easy, just copy the practice, but final is crazy hard. After final, i really do not know what i learn from her class.

She was good! Explained thigs really clearly and had good organization. Exams were just practice questions but a little different. No tricks here. Just straight forward do the work and do well econ class.

Took another class with her and again, Marie was excellent! Probably the best prof I've had at SFU so far. She is crystal clear, super organized, and goes over the important material over and over until you get it. I knew exactly what to expect on the exam. Top notch!
love being in her class.
A student can get a great grade from this course by this  Prof as long as he/she is good at ECON302! I rarely learnt anything from this course.

This prof is so much better than comments on here indicate. His exams are extremely easy (half of the questions are from practice midterms/ tutorial questions). He is extremely helpful and wants his students to do well. I expected a boring class and actually came to really enjoy it. Put in the work and you can reap HUGE rewards! Take his classes!

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!! HIS NOTES ARE USELESS AND WITH THAT AN EVEN MORE USELESS TEXTBOOK FULL OF ERRORS. Writes a bunch of algrebra that makes no sense, reading textbook just makes u even more confused. Doing questions from the book wont help u pass his 70% final

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS UNLESS YOU LOVE ALGEBRAIC MATH NOTES! He does no numerical examples in class, just messy chicken scratch algebraic math notes. 90% of my notes make no sense to me. Textbook sucks too. Overall terrible class! Dreading the 70% Final
His handwriting is poor, and he likes it...well, his exam was fine, but his lecture is boring, spends a lot of time on the material that was not in the exam, making simple concepts very complicated.

This man has the ability to make a simple concept that you already understand impossibly difficult. he will use letters instead of numbers in his examples so that you focus on the calculations rather than the concept. He will also spend time explaining ideas that won't show up in the exam and are not applicable to the real world. Just avoid him.
Awful. Not excessively difficult, just no teaching skills.
He put 30% for mid and 70% for final, and not curve this class. His hand writing is hard to read.

Terrible Prof. Assignments are hard, not related to his notes what so ever. His handwriting is hardly readable. Boring class, and it was just a disaster. Couldn't teach, not very clear, not to mention his exams and notes are completely different from Econ 302 but the materials are identical. Hard exams. Don't take him if u don't have to.
